title: PostgreSQLExercises

metadata.description: Learn about PostgreSQLExercises with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Exercises
Test your PostgreSQL skills with exercises from all categories:
Create table
Insert Data
Select Data
Add Column
Update Data
ALTER COLUMN
DROP COLUMN
DELETE
DROP TABLE
OPERATORS
SELECT
SELECT DISTINCT
WHERE
ORDER BY
LIMIT
MIN and MAX
COUNT
SUM
AVG
LIKE
IN
BETWEEN
AS
Joins
INNER JOIN
LEFT JOIN
RIGHT JOIN
FULL JOIN
CROSS JOIN
UNION
GROUP BY
HAVING
EXISTS
ANY
ALL
CASE

If you haven't already,

to become a W3Schooler, and get points for every exercise you complete.
As a logged on  user you will have access to many features like having
your own web page
,
track your learning progress
,
receive personal guided paths
, and
more
.
The Exercise
The exercises are a mix of "multiple choice" and "fill in the blanks" questions. 
There are between 3 and 9 questions in  each category.
The answer can be found in the corresponding tutorial chapter. If you're stuck, 
or answer wrong, you can try again or hit the "Show Answer" button to see the correct answer.
If you don't know PostgreSQL, we suggest that you read our
PostgreSQL Tutorial
from scratch.

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

summary: This tutorial covers PostgreSQLExercises concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PostgreSQLExercises effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PostgreSQLExercises and how to apply it in your projects.
